tags.description:
Create and manage the roles for an account. Roles are lists of permissions
that are explicitly tied to both a user and a group.
tags.name: Roles

tags.description: Get information about roles you can include in a new custom role.
tags.name: Grantable roles

post.description: This operation creates a custom role. A custom role combines [grantable roles](ref:get-grantable-roles) defined by Akamai. Roles exist at the account level regardless of group, but are constrained by contract type. If you create a role under one contract type, you can't apply that role to groups belonging to a different contract type, even if they're in the same account.

example.roleDescription: This role lets users edit or create reports.

grantedRoleId.description: Unique identifier for the grantable role. To get this value, run the [List grantable roles](ref:get-grantable-roles) operation.

roleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

Location.description: A URL path to the newly created object.

example.roleDescription: Provides users with edit and create access to reports.

schema.description: A role that includes granted roles.

type.description: Indicates whether it's a `standard` role provided by Akamai or a `custom` role for you to manage.

actions.description: Encapsulates permissions available to the user for this group. This data is available when you specify the `actions` parameter of the same name, not to be confused with the `action` parameter that applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.

delete.description: Indicates whether the user can remove items from the group.

edit.description: Indicates whether the user can modify items in the group.

createdBy.description: The username of the person who created the granted role.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the granted role was originally created.

grantedRoles.description: Within the role, there's a list of granted roles, giving the user access to objects in a group.

grantedRoleDescription.description: The description you supply for the granted role.

grantedRoleId.description: A unique identifier for each granted role.

grantedRoleName.description: The name you supply for the granted role.

modifiedBy.description: The username of the last person to edit the granted role.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the granted role was last updated.

roleId.description: A unique identifier for each role.

users.description: List of users who share the same role.

accountId.description: A unique identifier for each account.

lastLoginDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the user last logged in.

uiIdentityId.description: A unique identifier for a user's profile, which corresponds to a user's actual profile or client ID.

get.description: This operation lists roles for the current account and contract type or other accounts using the `accountSwitchKey` parameter. The account and contract type are determined by the access tokens in your API client.

parameters.name: actions
parameters.description: Includes information about actions such as `edit` or `delete` that you can take for the object, `false` by default. Don't confuse this with the `action` parameter, which applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Filters roles for a specific group. To get this value, run the [List groups](ref:get-groups) operation.

parameters.name: users
parameters.description: Returns users assigned to the roles, `false` by default.

parameters.name: ignoreContext
parameters.description: Returns all the roles for the current account, ignoring the contract type of your API client, `false` by default.

200.description: The response provides the roles for the account.

example.roleDescription: Users with this role can manage account settings in Identity and Access management application

type.description: Whether it's a `standard` or `account` role defined by Akamai, or a `custom` role created by one of your account's users. You can only modify or delete `custom` roles. To learn more, see [About roles](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam/docs/about-roles-permissions).

roleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the role was originally created.

createdBy.description: The user who created the role.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the role was last updated.

modifiedBy.description: The user who last edited the role.

actions.description: Specifies activities available for the role.

delete.description: Whether you can remove the role from the account. You can't remove a group that contains resources or subgroups, or if users have roles on that group.

edit.description: Whether you can modify the role.

numUsers.description: The number of users who have the role.

users.description: User details. They appear only when you set the `users` query parameter to `true`.

uiIdentityId.description: Unique identifier for each user, which corresponds to their Control Center profile or client ID. Also known as a `contactId` in other APIs.

lastLoginDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the user last logged in.

get.description: This operation lists the grantable roles you can include in a new custom role, or add to an existing custom role.

grantedRoleId.description: Unique identifier for each granted role.

grantedRoleName.description: Descriptive label for the granted role.

grantedRoleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

parameters.name: roleId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for each role. To get this value, run the [List roles](ref:get-roles) operation.

get.description: This operation retrieves a role's details.

parameters.name: actions
parameters.description: Includes information about actions such as `edit` or `delete` that you can take for the object, `false` by default. Don't confuse this with the `action` parameter, which applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.

parameters.name: grantedRoles
parameters.description: Lists granted roles assigned for a role, `false` by default.

parameters.name: users
parameters.description: Returns users assigned to the roles, `false` by default.

200.description: The response provides the role's details.

example.roleDescription: This role will allow you to look at the security reports

schema.description: A role that includes granted roles.

type.description: Indicates whether it's a `standard` role provided by Akamai or a `custom` role for you to manage.

actions.description: Encapsulates permissions available to the user for this group. This data is available when you specify the `actions` parameter of the same name, not to be confused with the `action` parameter that applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.

delete.description: Indicates whether the user can remove items from the group.

edit.description: Indicates whether the user can modify items in the group.

createdBy.description: The username of the person who created the granted role.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the granted role was originally created.

grantedRoles.description: Within the role, there's a list of granted roles, giving the user access to objects in a group.

grantedRoleDescription.description: The description you supply for the granted role.

grantedRoleId.description: A unique identifier for each granted role.

grantedRoleName.description: The name you supply for the granted role.

modifiedBy.description: The username of the last person to edit the granted role.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the granted role was last updated.

roleId.description: A unique identifier for each role.

users.description: List of users who share the same role.

accountId.description: A unique identifier for each account.

lastLoginDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the user last logged in.

uiIdentityId.description: A unique identifier for a user's profile, which corresponds to a user's actual profile or client ID.

put.description: This operation adds or removes a role's group role assignments, along with other data such as name and description. When you modify a role, those changes affect existing API clients. Review all API clients belonging to the user before modifying a role.

example.roleDescription: Provides users with edit and create access to reports.

schema.description: Add or remove role assignments. When you modify a role, those changes affect existing API clients. Review all API clients belonging to the user before modifying a role.

grantedRoleId.description: Unique identifier for the grantable role. To get this value, run the [List grantable roles](ref:get-grantable-roles) operation.

roleDescription.description: Descriptive label for the role to convey its use.

200.description: The response reflects the modified role.

delete.description: This operation deletes a custom role. You can't delete a role if it's assigned to a user.
